message_1: A store owner knows that 60% of customers who visit the store will make a purchase on their first visit. Additionally, 70% of customers who make a purchase on their first visit will make a purchase on their next visit. What percentage of customers who visit the store will make a purchase on both their first and second visits?
message_2:
To find the percentage of customers who make a purchase on both their first and second visits, we can multiply the probabilities of the two events occurring.

Probability of making a purchase on the first visit = 60% = 0.60
Probability of making a purchase on the second visit given they made a purchase on the first visit = 70% = 0.70

Probability of making a purchase on both visits = 0.60 * 0.70 = 0.42

So, 42% of customers who visit the store will make a purchase on both their first and second visits.
